source_sentence: 佛說大如意寶珠輪牛王守護神呪經
translation: Sutra on the Great Wish-granting Jeweled Wheel of the Ox King Shouhu Shenzhouzhou
Amogha Tripiṭaka Translation by Edict
Thus I've heard.

source_sentence: 一時佛在波羅捺鹿野園中。
translation: One time, the Buddha was in the Deer Preserve of Vārāṇasī.
He helped five people, including Ajñāta Kauṇḍinya.
They turned the Dharma wheel of the four truths.
At the time, there was a celestial in the assembly.
He was called the god Ox-King.
He got up from his seat.
He bent his head and put his palms together.
He bowed his head with both feet bowed and said to the Buddha.
"Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我有隨心自在萬事滿足神呪。
translation: "I have this wonderful spell that makes my mind freely attain the fulfillment of my myriad affairs.
It's for the benefit of all sentient beings.
Please let the Bhagavān have compassion on me and listen to my wish to recite this great incantation.

source_sentence: 哀愍聽許我今欲說大神呪。
translation: Have mercy on me and grant me permission to recite this great incantation.
It was then that the Buddha praised him, saying.
"Good, you can quickly recite it.
I want to hear it.'
The god then spoke the mantra, saying.

source_sentence: 唵悉底嚕悉底嚕(利)伴惹伴惹[言*曩]謨履底伽補瑟底伽阿毗遮阿毗遮真多摩尼莎賀時薄伽梵。
translation: "Om siddhârtha siddhârtha (li) bhañja bhañja [speech*an] moṣṭigha puṣṭigha abhijña abhijña maṇiṣāḥ when the Bhagavān heard the spell.
He heard and spoke the spell.
He universally observed them all.
It's for the benefit and welfare of all sentient beings.
He spoke a verse, saying.

source_sentence: 世間諸眾生　　逼切諸貧苦　　雖求資有福　施與諸眾生　　令得無憂惱　　術力勝諸獸　哀愍諸眾生　　施與諸珍寶　　滿足諸希求　齊等諸天眾　　福力無等限時薄伽仙毗吉那仙以歡喜信樂心。
translation: "Although sentient beings in the world are stifled by poverty and suffering, they may seek to accumulate merit and bestow it on sentient beings, so that they may be free of distress. Their skills are superior to those of animals, and they have compassion for sentient beings, bestow treasures, fulfill longing requests, and equalize the merits of gods without limit.
He presents various kinds of fragrances, flowers, lamps, and brightness.
He made four offerings and so forth.
He paid homage to the Ox King Goddess Pearl Heaven.
He spoke a verse and said.

source_sentence: 塗香華鬘及燒香　　燈明飲食與錢帛　奉獻牛王神獸天　　納受悅預增勢力　威德神通遍諸色　　成種種色諸財寶　施與一切眾生類　　故我供養神獸天復次牛王珠天。
translation: "Paint incense, decorate flowers, burn incense, light lamps, food, drink, and money, and present them to the Ox King Goddess Animal Heaven. Accepting them and being pleased with them, they will increase their strength, virtue, and superknowledge, pervade all forms, and create various kinds of wealth and treasure that will be given to all sentient beings. Therefore, I will make offerings to the Goddess Animal Heaven.
He said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!
"Bhagavān, suppose there are good men and good women.
Suppose there are good men and good women who accept and uphold this sūtra.
How much merit will they accumulate?'
After he said this, the Buddha addressed the Ox King Jewel Heaven.
The Buddha told Ox-Horse King Chu.
"Suppose someone accepts and memorizes this sūtra.
From the time he first arouses his mind until he becomes a buddha.
That's a stock of merit in his body.

source_sentence: 是善男子善女人福德聚。
translation: It's a stock of merit of good men and good women.
It's exactly the same as theirs.
You should know it this way.
That good man and good woman ...
From the Tathāgata's mouth arises the son of the Buddha's mind.

source_sentence: 若是善男子善女人所方所。
translation: Suppose it's a good man or a good woman who goes to a place.
That's when they give and perform Buddha-works for the sake of living buddhas.

source_sentence: 是故若樂摧破魔軍利樂一切。
translation: Therefore, if they are happy to destroy the army of Māra, they'll benefit all of them.

source_sentence: 是故汝等欲得一切如來真實智惠者。
translation: Therefore, all of you who want to attain the true wisdom and benefit of the Tathāgatas should single-mindedly recite this sūtra.
You should whole-heartedly recite this sūtra.
It will quickly achieve all merits.
It's also called.
"There are five kinds of spiritual experience.
What are the five?
The first is that the person who accepts and memorizes it ...
He'll be able to destroy the army of Māra.
The second is whoever recites it.
He'll attain measureless merit in the present and future lives.
The third is the person who writes and makes offerings.

source_sentence: 今世後世得消滅無量億劫之所犯罪。
translation: In the present and hereafter, he or she will be able to extinguish crimes committed over measureless millions of eons.
He'll reach the stage of abhidharma.

source_sentence: 第四消除一切病苦壽命延長。
translation: Fourth, he'll be freed from all illness and prolonged life.

source_sentence: 第五得此寶珠一闕之分。
translation: Fifth, he'll obtain a portion of this precious pearl that's lacking in number.
He'll make offerings to it, recite it, read it, and venerate it.
It'll be reborn for generations to come.
He'll be reborn into a world of poverty and suffering.
It will cause him to attain the inexhaustible fruit of the esoteric store.
It was then that the Buddha spoke this sūtra.
All the people in the congregation rejoiced.
They all rejoiced greatly.
They believed, accepted, and approved of it.

source_sentence: 佛說大如意寶珠牛王守護神呪經
translation: Foshuo dashi ruyi baoshu niuwang shouhu shenzhou jing

source_sentence: 元應二年十一月二十八日以快玄得業本寫之竟金剛資賴心此書尾城南真福密寺藏祕本東南院任瑜法親王相傳之古本也。
translation: On the 28th day of the 11th month in the second year of Gengyō's reign, I wrote this in a book called Jingang zilaixin (Jingang zilaixin), which is a copy of the ancient book transmitted by Ren Yu, the Prince of Dharma, of the Donan Temple.
